Reviews.Title: Just what I was looking for!
Reviews.Author: savvy shopper
Reviews.Content: I was thrilled to find this phone!  I got mine throught Tracfone with the triple minutes for life.  I had been looking for a phone with these features- voice dialing and voice commands, slide out qwerty keyboard and the most important feature of them all- CDMA coverage!  Yes, it uses Verizon towers!  It seems that CDMA prepaid phones are in the minority as far as cell phones go.  That being said, it really fit the bill!  Thanks Tracfone and Net 10!  Keep bringing us those CDMA phones!

Reviews.Title: Great NET10 Replacement Phone
Reviews.Author: Travis
Reviews.Content: Previously had a low cost $20 cell phone from NET10 and this one hands down is 10x better just in the battery life.  The other one from the word go required charging every 2-3 days with little to no use.  If I was traveling I would have 1-2 hrs of talk time before the battery was completely dead, usually required a recharge after 4-6 hours.This phone on the other hand can last 10-14 days even with use and the slide out keyboard is pretty nice.  It would be nice if the menu was customizable.  Another major complaint is the camera button does not work.  To use hte camera you have to go into several sub menus, what a pain.Finally the other BIG DRAWBACK is the phone deducts minutes the second you hit the send button to make a call.  Whether you connect or not you are going to get charged the minute charge and the clock will start ticking from the moment you press send.  Definitely a detractor seeing how every other NET10 phone didn't start charging you until the call actually connected, AS IT SHOULD!!!!All in all a great NET10 phone.

Reviews.Title: LOVE THIS PHONE
Reviews.Author: Pam Carter
Reviews.Content: I bought this phone and orignally I had the NET 10 but it was too complecated to get the minutes and they were more expensive through net 10/ so I brought it back and went to wlmart and got this in the straight talk phone for 30.00 1000 min/1000 texts  I love it best buy ever, I was with VeriZon for 9 years/ we pay much less now and great coverage!!!!!!!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: Alright
Reviews.Author: K. Bibey
Reviews.Content: Not too bad. Phone OS could really use a nice touch up, however. Calls unforutnately sound distorted and hard to hear, however. Phone can scratch easily on the back case. It works when you need it, and that's honestly it. Nothing fancy like an iPhone or Andriod phones. Games are very basic.Overall not a bad buy.

Reviews.Title: OK, some lower than advertised performance
Reviews.Author: Loyal J. Martin
Reviews.Content: Was "bait & switch"  Advertised as Tracfone w/ triple minutes by Tracfone. Changed to Net 10 w/o triple min. when I got it from Amazon.Phone works OK.  Took awhile to learn menus.Also bragged as 12 days batt. on standby.  So far mine does 4-6 at best.Camera works well when I've gotten through the menus.Locked up once.  Local Radio Shack helped --  pulled battery and it "rebooted" itself and went to work.

Reviews.Title: Love Net10, Love this phone!
Reviews.Author: C. Bauman "bauman171"
Reviews.Content: I bought this phone as a replacement to the identical one I accidentally broke.  It's easy to use, customizable and has a bright display (easy to see in daylight) and is compatible with Net10 service.  The only downsides I have come up with for this phone are 1) it's not compatible with the Cellular One computers that can transfer your contact list from another phone to this one, and 2) you have to remove the back of the phone to access the microSDHC card (I think this is not unusual, but it is still inconvenient).The battery usually lasts me about four days before it requires recharging (I usually charge it when it's down to one bar, but also keep in mind I don't use the phone a lot, mostly just texting with a few phone calls a week and occasional pics taken).  The camera is sufficient- I think the quality one would expect from a cell phone.One downside to this phone is that there is no setting to turn off the ringer/alert but keep the alarm on.  You can turn the sound completely off or turn it on, that's it.Another note- the headset that I have used on my last LG phone and another Samsung that I previously owned does not work on the this phone.

Reviews.Title: good phone
Reviews.Author: J.Rushing
Reviews.Content: only thing that annoys me is that there is a 160 character limit and you can not have multiple pages of text. as long as you texts are short you will be fine but if you like typing a short story then you will have to send it in chunks.

Reviews.Title: Great inexpensive phone
Reviews.Author: C. Lyon "C"
Reviews.Content: I bought this for my son for Christmas.  He had an older version and had horrible reception inside our house.  This phone  seems to work everywhere.

Reviews.Title: phone works fine but price jacked up after wait on the delivery
Reviews.Author: Jody Lynn
Reviews.Content: title says it all.  this phone was supposed to be 44.00 approx., not 67.00. hope they fix this.  I was happy to wait for the phone.  It was a replacement for the same kind that is broken, but all  we need is a basic like this with a qwerty key board.  However, don't pull something like this.

Reviews.Title: Looks Awesome in an (MetroPCS/StraightTalk) Rubberized Design Cover!
Reviews.Author: BellyDance808
Reviews.Content: Has slightly larger display and better resolution/contrast for texting than my previous Samsung T401G. Really like the Voice Dialing/Commands option when hooked-up to Bluetooth headset when driving. Qwerty keyboard shape/layout with slightly raised keys is taking some time to get used to. I do miss not having Copy/Paste option in Text Message to save texted phone #s or websites; and being able to customize the central Navigation key. Sturdy, good battery life, and looks just beautiful in the "Rubberized Design Cover" from the CellAccessoriesStore (USA Seller) – Mahalo!

Reviews.Title: GREAT VALUE - NICE FEATURES
Reviews.Author: Carlitos
Reviews.Content: This is a big step up from the previous Samsung slider I had with Trac-Fone.  Long battery life, 4- 5 days general use.  Not a smartphone but full features and truly excellent signal reception in central NY State using plentiful Verizon towers.  I would have given 5 stars except: you can accidentally hit he browser key for unintentional surf and non-standard earphone port.  Holds up to 16bg micro-SD card.  The retro slider keyboard is a practical feature.  At the price it's practically FREE!  We bought three.

Reviews.Title: Problem With Using a Carrying Case
Reviews.Author: Andrew L. Kramer
Reviews.Content: I bought a carrying case for my new R455c and everytime I put the phone in it, the keyboard would unlock. It drove me crazy until I figured out it was the magnet in the clasp. I had to buy another with a velcro closure.

Reviews.Title: Meh
Reviews.Author: Janice Schweikert "jmsaot"
Reviews.Content: First of all, Net 10 has great prices but rotten customer service...This phone isn't that easy to use; seems like you have to jump through hoops to get to the camera so don't rely on it for anything thats happening fast.  Very, very easy to bump the volume button so thats a pain.  I've turned the volume off by accident a few times as a result...it could be worse...but it could be a whole lot more user friendly also...

Reviews.Title: The little phone that ... nah, it couldn't.
Reviews.Author: Tio
Reviews.Content: I wanted to like this phone. I live in Maine which has a strong US Cellular presence and they are a CDMA carrier. Logically, having a CDMA phone would give me extended coverage around the state over GSM. What turned my opinion on the phone was how poorly it worked in my home calling area in Portland. Calls from my house were plagued with echoes. Signal stength didn't matter, 4 bars, 1 bar, as long as I was within a mile of my house I got an echo. There were places out and about where the phone worked wonderfully, better than my wife's NET10 GSM phone, but that alone didn't justify keeping the phone. More often than not the signal was fleeting, going from home to roam, 4 bars to 1 for no reason I could figure out.Overall, sound quality was disappointing. This may be an issue of samsungs of this generation because two phones, the 455 and 404, had poor voice quality issues. They were gurgley.Physically, it's a blocky phone. Thick in the pocket, thicker than the s404 and twice as thick as the lg500 that replaced it.I bought the phone for the slider option to increase my texting speed, which it did do, but the keyboard does not feel as good or seems to be as functional as the s404's.Likes: I do like that the phone can use full mp3s as ring tones. Battery life was great for the month that I had it. As all reviews for NET10 phones seem to indicate, the browser button is in a bad place, but the keyboard lock worked well to keep from pocket surfing the web, the sad thing that it is for NET10 service. Opening the slider is the fastest way to turn the keypad lock off to get to texts and what not.I returned this phone to amazon and they were great about issuing me an RMA at the 30 day mark. Net10s customer service was informative and effective in checking out whether the phone was working properly first. Unfortunately, it was. I got stuck with the s404, but that's another review.

Reviews.Title: Love this phone...why did it say triple minutes???  It does not triple when I buy a card
Reviews.Author: Jeanne Rockafellow
Reviews.Content: I love this phone...but I thought it had triple minutes when I purchase my Net10 card!!!  It does not triple when I purchase a card

Reviews.Title: no set up
Reviews.Author: terri guyer
Reviews.Content: This phone may be good,if you can get it set up! I have no cell signal at my home,so had a "smart" friend trying to set it . She got part way & then had to call customer service. Put on hold for 1/2 hour yesterday,then the same today. Still no farther ahead. No one ever answered so she had no choice but to hang up. Sending phone back !!!!

Reviews.Title: NO games
Reviews.Author: Zein okeh "zein"
Reviews.Content: this phone arrive two days ago and i'm happy for that, and after i see all about features there's no games on it. i was download java games for samsung but cannot running just no game when i check in games and app.Nice look and great with qwerty.

Reviews.Title: no
Reviews.Author: mallisa
Reviews.Content: I got this phone as just kind of a basic easy to use slider phone for my mom and its actually hard to figure out and the more we looked through it, it has no video cam which all phones should have if the have the cam option. make sure you read all details.

Reviews.Title: Mrsath
Reviews.Author: mrsathdawg34
Reviews.Content: Horrible phone. This phone is garbage and is way over priced. Don't buy this phone. Spent your money on a better phone. This is sub-standard quality.

ProductInfo.Features:
Affordable messaging phone with slide-out full QWERTY keyboard, Bluetooth, and 1.3-megapixel camera/camcorder;Display size 3.36
Pay-as-you-go with all local, long distance and roaming calls at 10 cents per minute
MP3 player; microSD memory expansion; hands-free speakerphone; 1000-contact phonebook; HTML web browser
Up to 6 hours of talk time, up to 12.5 days of standby time
What's in the Box: handset, rechargeable battery, charger, services guide
Affordable messaging phone with slide-out full QWERTY keyboard, Bluetooth, and 1.3-megapixel camera/camcorder
ProductInfo.Name: Samsung R455C Prepaid Phone (Net10)
